k9sğª
Kubernetes CLI To Manage Your Clusters In Style!





CLI

K9sğª CLI comes with a view options to launch the tool with different configurations.

# List all available CLI options
k9salpha help

# Get info about K9sğª runtime (logs, configs, etc..)
k9salpha info

# Run K9sğª in a given namespace.
k9salpha -n mycoolns

# Run K9sğª and launch in pod view via the pod command.
k9salpha -c pod

# Start K9sğª in a non default KubeConfig context
k9salpha --context coolCtx

# Start K9sğª in readonly mode - with all modification commands disabled
k9salpha --readonly


In App KeyBoard Bindings

Action Example Description
Help ? Display context sensitive help
Aliases ctrl-a List available cluster resources and aliases
Exit :q, ctrl-c Terminates the application
View a resource :resourceâ Accepts singular, plural, short-name or alias ie :po,:pod,:pods to list pods
Navigate to a resource in a given namespace :resourcce namespaceâ List pods in namespace kube-system :po kube-system
Filter out a resource view given a filter /filterâ Regex2 supported ie fred|blee to filter resources named fred or blee
Inverse regex filer /! filterâ Keep everything that doesnâ€™t match.
Filter resource by labels /-l app=fredâ filter pods with labels app=fred
Fuzzy find a resource given a filter /-f filterâ Â 
Bails out of view/command/filter mode <esc> Â 
Key mapping to describe, view, edit, view logs,â€¦ d,v, e, l,â€¦ Â 
List K8s Contexts :ctxâ List all available from kubeconfig or env var
Navigate to a given context :ctx context-nameâ Switch to fred context :ctx fred
List all K8s namespaces :nsâ Â 
To view all saved resources :screendump or sdâ View all screen dump
To delete a resource ctrl-d Dialog pops up to confirm (use TAB/SHIFT-TAB,ENTER to navigate fields
Force delete a resource ctrl-k NOTE: Power users - No confirmation dialog
